Reviews.Title: “Modern, sleek, and intimate.”
Reviews.Author: Seanmage
Reviews.Content: Two nights here in a very well designed set of two rooms: one a bedroom and the other a living workspace. Both rooms are on the small side but so well designed with every modern amenity similar to the cabins on 5 star luxury liners, that the experience is excellent. The breakfast was excellent and the pool, and workout facility as well as the Turkish bath and spa are incredible. This is a gem and well worth sacrificing the large scale spaces of other nearby hotels for the intimacy and aesthetic of a chic Boutique hotel. Very good service.

Reviews.Title: “I found my new place to be in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Liteworker
Reviews.Content: Everything... Staff was excellent, they really understand "service" without being too present, without overdoing it or overstating their presence. Rooms are beautiful, well designed, spacious, great bathroom, good bed. Breakfast, the restaurant and in room dining are all very good quality, good service and diversity. I would certainly recommend it to anyone. And I found my new place to be in Istanbul for the next time If I need to address one bad element : Charging for WIFI or internet. It's so year 2000 to charge for that. Any decent 4 or 5 star hotel should give this as a free service. It is like if you would have to pay for the soap in the bathroom. I would offer a limited free service in the room like 10MBit performance, upload and download limits. But then offer a premium service for 200MBit performance and no limits for instance. That I would be happy to pay for. But now paying 26TL per day for a very limited and slow internet service is going against my sense of fairness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorradoConforti
Reviews.Content: Was here for a business trip. The hotel is very close to the Taksim square, so in the very city center, at walking distance from the restaurant and shopping area. It's a fully renewed hotel, with a good service and very good rooms. Something is not perfect, so I can not give a 5 stars: - air conditioning too noisy - the luxury restoom smells (!). It's a shame for such beatiful room, but something is happening in the water pipes.. asked to the reception, but no help. - no free internet connection. The swisscom wifi is expensive (15â‚¬/24h) and not reliable. The room is big and fantastic, very good bed, great pillows. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect renovation. Perfect location. Perfect Service.”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: I am still staying at this hotel, but had to post right away to share my enthusiasm for this gem of a hotel. I had stayed at the Divan several years ago, prior to the renovation and have watched them building over the past three years. It has been worth the wait. Everything about this hotel is fantastic! From the initial impression upon entering the lobby to the beautfiul rooms, the spectacular spa area and of course the classis Divan Patisserie. I have stayed in all of the hotels that I can view from my room (Hyatt, InterContinental, and The Marmara) and this is hands down my most favorite. The rooms are a ncie blend of beiges and browns. The marble bathrooms are spacious, featuring Molton Brown products with a separate shower and bath. There is an in-room safe to accommodate laptop (with charging station) and a nice selection in the minibar. Little details are well thought out with electronically controlled shades, tv speakers in the bathroom and 3 telephones in the room. The spa/fitness area is one of the finest I have seen - real resort quality with candle lit hallways, high ceilinged corridors, relaxation rooms, steam room, sauna, a hammam,a Pilates studio and a wonderful pool. All of the staff is courteous to a fault and aim to please. I asked for a room change and they were quick to oblige. If you are seeking a nice place to rest after a long day of sightseeing, a romantic getaway or even a staycation, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Noisy and Smokey!”
Reviews.Author: matkincc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and the decor and service are very good and the staff are professional, friendly and courteous. However, despite getting a non smoking room there is no difference as the smell of smoke is everywhere. The real problem is the 24/7 traffic noise from the road outside the hotel. Always ask for a room at the rear of the hotel. One final point, it takes about an hour to get to and from the I net rational Airport and costs about 60 Turkish Lire and make sure your insurance is up to date and wear a seat belt!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, great rates and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ahmadsameh
Reviews.Content: i decided to try them after staying at the Bursa property. The hotel is brand new as it has just undergone a complete renovation. Location is GREAT as it is close to the heart of town Istiklal/Taksim and also walking distance to the trendy Nisantasi area. I was offered a great rate and an upgrade to a deluxe room since it was low season so i thought that was very nice. The rooms are superb and very tastefully furnished and comfortable large bed. Big bathroom with rain shower and Molton Brown toiletries. (somehow very similar to a Four Seasons room) ..i also tried room service for dinner and the food was great and not too pricey. The staff were very nice and polite and all very good looking..so it seems they were very well picked. The only problem i had was NO hot water in the shower two days in a row which they failed to fix despite me complaining twice. Overall i was very happy with everything, however i will not be returning since i think the days of big hotels with lobbies full of people are over for me, i will stick to my all time favorite Park Hyatt whenever in Istanbul since nothing beats it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: turkeyOgel
Reviews.Content: Divan was one of the legendary hotels of Istanbul before the tourist rush of 1980s. It was certainly a wonderful experience staying there after the recent renovation last week . The new DÄ±van opened its doors again in sept.2012. We stayed in one of their ''Premier King ''rooms which actually deserves to be called a suit. It is been done up to perfection. Excellent bathroom,very confortable beds,all the luxury amanities and facilities one would expect from a 5 star hotel such as flat screen TVs(but no in - room movies service ????),etc... The rooms use too much of brown for my taste,I would have expected some color to cheer up the rooms.The room service was quick and efficient Overall the staff from front dest to doormen were simply excellent,probably the best staff and also the nicest in any Istanbul hotel we have ever stayed in. Wireless internet was charged 15 Euros per day.I would have expected the wireless service to be free in the suit level rooms.That was a dissapointment. The location of the hotel is very desirable and I would certainly stay in Divan again without any hesitation when I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Expert_09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate, I stayed In October on a Business Trip and was very surprised with the quality and over all finish of the hotel. It has been recently refurbed from top to bottom so the old style building has a brand new Modern contemporary look. The hotel is around 1hr from the Airport (But this is only due to the heavy traffic)!! Around the hotel there are plenty of Kebab Shops, Massage parlours, Boutiques and Restaraunts. Taxim square is approx a 10min slow walk from the hotel, but be careful, the car drivers are all mental and will stop for no one! The hotel Staff were excellent, always very friendly and happy to help in any way they can. I did have the chance to use the leisure facilities and you will need a Pool Cap! even if you have no hair! The food was very impressive, there was a huge selection, just keep in mind this hotel does not do your traditional Sausages / Baked Beans etc! However Turkeys version of these foods was a nice surprise and change. The room I had was very very nice.... Luxury to say the least! The bed was huge, with free TV and all channels available. Work area was very....Oldy Worldy with Dark wood finishing and padded light brown arm chair. However the Bathroom / Toilet was amazing! The shower was by far the best shower I have ever been in....and believe me you wont want to get out, the toilet has a little sprinkler wash thing and be careful because the button looks like the flush and I got soaked!!! If you have any questions please feel free to throw them my way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cryuff
Reviews.Content: After staying at the intercontinental for 6 nights, we moved to Divan for 1 night as Intercontinental's rates for New Year weekend doubled. Divan is across the street from Intercontinental .... it's very new and modern. Though we enjoyed our stay at Intercontinental and have no complaints, Divan was a class above....excellent facilities, beautiful Spa, great rooms. We got upgraded to Deluxe King room, whose bathroom was almost as big as the room. Only regret, wish we had stayed at this hotel the other 6 nights as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have recently stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: PickyYay
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Istanbul business trip and very happy with the chosen hotel! You will not find bad feedback in this review! No way! Will start with the location - it is perfect. Right next to Taksim square and Besiktas stadium. It is very close to famous DolmaBahce palace and famous shopping street Nisantasi from the other side. The hotel itself is totally renovated. So fresh and clean, very cozy and nice inside. The staff is extremely polite and helpful! Rooms are so comfortable, size is right to the point and design is great! Even if my windows were looking to the road, I slept like an angel because of silence. The bathroom is huge! They even have scales there. Service was on a very good level. The food is great! Products are fresh and breakfast is very rich and tasty! Hotel has own sweets shop and every day after room service is done you can find chocolate next to your bed! :) The only small minus is that internet is not for free. We also arranged one of the meeting rooms for the presentation and it was very comfortable and neat. The snack set was very fresh with a good range of products and good service. I also can recommend it for any celebrations, as they have very nice banquet halls. In general I liked the hotel a lot and will stay there again for 100%!!! To my opinion this is the one of the best hotels of Istanbul. Highly recommended! Check out the pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the heart of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: RCK52
Reviews.Content: The Divan used to be a big hotel with a great location on Taksim Square with worn rooms and tired public spaces. After two years and millions of dollars, the Koc Group has created one of the best hotels anywhere in the world. The rooms are larege and well appointed. The bathrooms, in particular, will satisfy the most fussy business traveler and the most fastidious tourist. Large, good products, hot strong shower. Everything you will want. The beds are wonderful even if you have to struggle a bit to turn off all of the lights and lower the shade. The Divan has a great small bar and a very good Turkish restaurant. It also has a Japanese restaurant that has attracted a lot of attention. I tried it and I would urge you to go Turkish. The Japanese cuisine is fine but the staff doesn't know how to guide most people through the incredibly complicated menu. And, the Kaizei menu, which receives rave reviews, has to be ordered in advance which meant that I did not try it. All in all, this is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in over the past three years and I have stayed in some very good ones in London, Berlin, Chicago, Tokyo and Seoul. I should also add that the rates are a bargain right now. Once word is out on the quality of this place, that will change.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: marco_and_nadine
Reviews.Content: A note to start: there are several Divan hotels in Istanbul. They are named in a way that sometimes you might get confused between them. The names of the streets do not help a lot. I am rating here the one in Cumhuriyer cad. Having said that, the hotel is extremely pleasant. Medium size (not a mammoth hotel) which helps to make you feel home. Very elegant without excesses. An excellent feeling of "new" (which in my opinion is very important in hotels). Personnel extremely helpful without being too heavy (for example they do not insist in accompanying you in the room at check-in unless you need it, which I find very appropriate). Both rooms and bathrooms are very spacious. Breakfast offers a very large and first class choice. If I have to find one small fault, is about the long time needed to get really hot water in the shower. A you see, a very marginal issue. The hotel is in great location both for tourist and for business travellers which have their business in the surroundings. I'm saying that because, as everybody that has been in Istanbul knows, the traffic is really heavy in this huge city, especially at certain times in the day (late afternoon you better walk) and cars can find themselves stuck for very long time. All in all a highly recommendable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Feza K
Reviews.Content: Dear Trip Advisor, We stayed at Divan Hotel Taksim, Istanbul between Nov 6-9, 2011 and we are writing to let you know that our stay was excellent. This was not our first stay and in one of our previous stays the hotel staff was very kind to supply warm milk to our son at midnight. This was the reason why we preferred Divan as our first choice to stay in Istanbul. Divan Istanbul just opened its door after exclusive renovation. Food is excellent as it always has been. We never wanted to walk off from breakfast as fruits, bread and yogurt was as home made. You can easily feel the quality and sensitive touch of the hotel management at each location. First of all, all the staff is friendly and smiling. They try to do their best at all instances. One night we invited our Australian and Japanese friends for tea to the bar. Although it was not in their menu the staff picked up Turkish tea from the pastry and served Udon from the Japanese restaurant of the hotel. One night we dined at the Turkish restaurant of the hotel. The risotto was the best we ever tried. Our son went for Tandir kebab which was also excellent. Their vine menu and fresh fruit drink were also excellent. Our son who is 12 years old received a connecting room for him. Needles to say, he enjoyed his own TV channels as a courtesy of the hotel management. Although located at the center of Taksim, the rooms were very quiet due to good isolation. A delicate of touch for the bed and furniture including all details of the bathroom makes us think that we will look forward staying in this hotel soon again. The only draw back was the pool that was under construction but we never had the will to swim during our stay. We cordially recommend the Divan hotel due to its very good location and hospitality. The price you pay is worth it. Feza Korkusuz MD

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elena123_11
Reviews.Content: Divan hotel,in Istanbul,near Taksim is a brand new hotel,absolutely amazing!I was there for 3 days with my husband and we really enjoyed everything about it.The hotel is new,extremly well decorated,nice lobby bar,very good restaurant on the first floor,great coffee and bar with fantastic terrasse also on the ground floor.Service is great,as always in Turkey,the hotel has a brand new SPA which is fantastic (please note that as usual in muslim countries the SPA is separated men/women).Another advantage is the location-near Teksim and the metro,bus stop going to the Airport every 20 min is 50m away from the hotel (which is 25 km from the International airport). This hotel gives you the desire to come back in Istanbul for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlr24
Reviews.Content: We chose the Divan Istanbul after a fabulous stay at the Divan Bodrum on our honeymoon. We arrived in Istanbul and stayed one night somewhere else, but it couldn't compare, so we switched! Service at Divan Istabul was excellent, the location was good, and the hotel rooms were large, comfortable and attractive. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet on the patio each morning as well. It was nice to be able to walk through Taksim Square and wander the pedestrian street for dinner, drinks, etc., while still being able to go to sleep somewhere quiet. Our main complaint was that the Divan did not offer access to a gym or pool while theirs is under construction. Instead we had to pay ($50+) to use the gym at another hotel next door. The Divan should have made arrangements for guests during construction and found a way to provide guest passes. One more suggestion to management: the showers are big and lovely, but leak all over the bathroom. Sealing the shower door would help a lot. Overall, the Divan was an excellent place to stay and we will go back. Especially since the hotel just opened, they are doing a great job!

Reviews.Title: “A freshly rennovated Istanbul Classic with some small design flaws”
Reviews.Author: Utku67
Reviews.Content: Divan hitel with its legendary Divan Lokantasi with its hugh Turkish cusine is back agan after a 2 year long total rennovation. But I found the furniture especially in the lobby and in the Japanese restaurant very uncomfortable. It is obvious that the furniture hasbeen designed without taking the ergonomy into consideration. I have used only the Japanese restaurants and I think that tge Japanese chefs are briliant. I highly reccommend for Japanese food lovers.

HotelInfo.Name: Divan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cumhuriyet Caddesi No 2 Elmadag | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
